header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the availability of Bitcoin Core's version v28.0rc1 for download and testing, marking a significant update with detailed release notes to guide users and developers through the new features and improvements. This version is a step forward in the software's development, emphasizing the community's role in refining the release through real-world testing and feedback. Preliminary information and resources for this release candidate can be found at [Bitcoin Core](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/28.0-Release-Notes-Draft).

Antoine Riard advocates for the establishment of "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes on Bitcoin's mainnet to facilitate real-world testing of sophisticated cross-layer attacks, such as pinning. This initiative aims to enhance the ecosystem's security by demonstrating attack feasibility and severity in a controlled environment, contrasting with less realistic testnet scenarios. The proposal details and the rationale behind using default mainnet settings for a more accurate assessment are discussed at [Linux Foundation's mailing list archive](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-May/018925.html).

Victor K. of StarkWare highlights the potential for achieving general computation on Bitcoin, leveraging the Taproot upgrade and proposing the re-enabling of OP_CAT opcode for enhanced script expressibility and complexity. This development could revolutionize Bitcoin's utility, enabling smart contracts and sophisticated off-chain computation verification through STARK proofs. The conversation outlines the technical and conceptual advancements towards embedding more complex applications on the Bitcoin blockchain, with further details available at [Delving into Bitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-path-to-general-computation-on-bitcoin-with-op-cat/1106).

Fi3 discusses the ongoing development of an SV2 extension designed to improve mining pool payout transparency and fairness by allowing miners to select transactions and influence mining job fee structures. This initiative, which builds on the Pay-Per-Last-N-Shares system, is in the review stage and seeks contributions to refine the proposal, demonstrating a commitment to enhancing miner autonomy and efficiency in the Bitcoin mining ecosystem. The project's specifics and operational framework are detailed in the proposal at [GitHub](https://github.com/demand-open-source/share-accounting-ext/blob/281c1cbc4f9a07b21a443753a525197dc5d8e18c/extension.md).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Candidate 1 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's latest release candidate, v28.0rc1, is now available for download.
- Preliminary release notes offering insights into the new version's improvements are accessible online.
- The release aims to gather user feedback to resolve critical issues before the final v28.0 launch.

recent_posts.title: Demonstrating Pinning Attacks under Real-World Conditions
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine proposes establishing "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes to test attacks in real-world conditions.
- The setup involves using default mainnet configurations for full and lightning nodes for realistic testing.
- The initiative aims to expose vulnerabilities and discuss the security of the Bitcoin ecosystem transparently.

recent_posts.title: Keyless Anchors Are Vulnerable To Replacement Cycling Attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses Bitcoin transaction vulnerabilities, especially in ephemeral anchors and replacement attacks.
- It highlights how Lightning Service Providers and exchanges can exploit these vulnerabilities.
- The communication also addresses the challenges in countering these attacks effectively due to computational limits.

recent_posts.title: Casual research on running `mempoolfullrbf`
recent_posts.summary:
- Concerns about noise from five-minute snapshots with full-RBF were discussed.
- Transactions under full-RBF are likely to be replaced more frequently, affecting analyses.
- An alternative suggests measuring post-block announcement transaction retrievals for accuracy.

recent_posts.title: The path to general computation on Bitcoin (with OP_CAT)
recent_posts.summary:
- Taproot upgrade in 2021 enhanced Bitcoin's capability for complex applications by easing script restrictions.
- Covenants and STARK proofs pave the way for stateful smart contracts and off-chain computation verification on Bitcoin.
- OP_CAT reinstatement is key to fully leveraging new computational tools and broadening Bitcoin's application scope.

recent_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
recent_posts.summary:
- Development of an SV2 extension for mining pool payout fairness is ongoing.
- The extension offers miners the ability to select transactions, enhancing control.
- Active project seeks reviews to refine the system, with details available on GitHub.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's design poses risks for mining pools due to block withholding attacks and validation issues.
- A negotiated template approach is suggested to enhance security and ensure fairness in miner contributions.
- The discussion includes potential protocol changes to improve mining operations' privacy and efficiency.

active_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
active_posts.summary:
- The OP_ZKP proposal seeks to embed Zero-Knowledge Proofs in Bitcoin, emphasizing a suitable ZKP scheme.
- Security and small proof sizes are crucial, with batched verification needed for blockchain efficiency.
- IPA offers a potential solution, though scalability and the deployment of large verification keys remain issues.

active_posts.title: OP_CAT Research Fund sponsored by StarkWare
active_posts.summary:
- StarkWare launches a $1 million bounty for perspectives on OP_CAT's activation.
- The committee includes figures from Blockstream, BastionZero, and others, focusing on security and innovation.
- Community members are encouraged to submit arguments through StarkWare's provided link.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal critiques Bitcoin's protocol, highlighting vulnerabilities and inefficiencies needing fixes.
- It suggests improvements like adjusting mining difficulty and invalidating small transactions for better security.
- Community debate focuses on impacts of reducing block size and standardizing technical elements on scalability.

active_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
active_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies include passive holding and active management of assets.
- Passive investment may cause societal issues like asset underutilization and misaligned agent intentions.
- The article considers central banks using deflationary currencies like Bitcoin to stabilize economies.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- The crackdown on privacy tools has significantly impacted Bitcoin privacy services.
- New alternatives for Bitcoin privacy, like the BTCPay Server CoinJoin plugin, have emerged.
- The author has created their own BTCPay coordinator to enhance transactional privacy.

today_in_history_posts.title: "Compressed" headers stream
today_in_history_posts.summary:

today_in_history_posts.title: BOLT 11, real time micro payments, and route redundancy
today_in_history_posts.summary:

- Concerns about real-time micropayments for vehicles and the viability of automatic failover routes are raised.

today_in_history_posts.title: Public archive for Delving Bitcoin
today_in_history_posts.summary:

- Discussed methods include scraping, API use, and database dumping, with challenges noted.
